title: 'Critics say it's a long rollercoaster ride ahead for Labour - but the panic is over'
description: Labour secured a double by-election victory on Thursday after a 'catastrophic' handling of an anti-semitism row. Keir Mudie believes the party 'can hold things together and keep focus'

title: By-elections: Tory gloom deepens after double poll blow
description: The results underline the current likelihood, if the mood of the electorate does not shift, of Labour winning the general election. But Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer is going out of his way to avoid even the merest whiff of complacency. More to do despite ...

title: Labour ready for difficult decisions in new age of insecurity, Starmer says
description: Sir Keir Starmer will insist Labour can deliver ‘security for decades’ as he addresses his party’s Scottish conference in Glasgow on Sunday.

title: General election is not a done deal…but disillusioned Tory voters staying home is straw that PM & the party must grasp
description: LABOUR are now a general election juggernaut and pointing out that some of the wheels are a bit wonky is not going to stop them. Labour’s problems only seem to help their cause. Dumping their

title: General election: When is the next one and who decides?
description: Speculation is growing about when the next general election will take place, after the Conservatives lost another two by-elections to Labour. In January, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said he had expected to call the election "in the second half" of 2024.

title: Keir Starmer reportedly wanted to quit after 2021 byelection defeat
description: Labour leader thought loss to Tories in Hartlepool meant party going backward, according to new biography

title: Nicola Sturgeon downfall triggers exodus of SNP supporters in crisis for Humza Yousaf
description: A glaring weakness has been revealed in the SNP’s election chances following the resignation of Nicola Sturgeon. Key to the SNP ’s previous road to Holyrood was a policy focus on middle-class voters. But recent polling analysis shows that that same target group are leaving the party in droves ever since Ms Sturgeon’s resignation.

title: Keir Starmer nearly quit after Hartlepool by-election defeat, says new biography
description: The by-election loss in May 2021 in the Co Durham constituency was a bitter blow to Sir Keir Starmer and his top team.

title: Labour ready for difficult decisions in new age of insecurity, Starmer says
description: Sir Keir Starmer will insist Labour can deliver ‘security for decades’ as he addresses his party’s Scottish conference in Glasgow on Sunday.

title: ‘Tory MPs hunting for jobs because they sense humiliating defeat is inevitable’ – pollster
description: “In American sports parlance (thanks, Taylor Swift), Rishi Sunak is now 1/6 in Conservative by-election defences, his sole victory coming in Boris Johnson ’s symbolic former seat, while the five defeats (four to Labour and one to the Lib Dems) rank as the 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 7th and 9th worst by-election Conservative swings to Labour since the war.”

title: Ian Murray: Labour can turn Glasgow red at next election
description: Labour’s shadow Scottish secretary challenged Rishi Sunak to put the country “out of this Tory misery” and call a general election now.

title: Senior Pakistani official admits helping to rig election
description: A senior Pakistani official on Saturday admitted he helped rig the country’s elections, a week after polls marred by allegations of manipulation returned no clear winner. Liaqat Ali Chattha, commissioner of the garrison city of Rawalpindi, where the country’s powerful military has its headquarters, said he would hand himself over to police.

title: Laura Kuenssberg: Tory by-election disaster shows power of ‘sofa vote’
description: The results this week are as much about Conservative voters staying home as it is about them turning to Labour.

title: Friend or foe? The Conservative Party misjudges Nigel Farage at its peril

description: Former president and co-defendants owe a total of $463.9m including interest after judge rules in favour of New York Attorney General Letitia James

title: Labour’s Ian Murray challenges Sunak to name the day for general election
description: Labour’s shadow Scottish secretary challenged Rishi Sunak to put the country “out of this Tory misery” and call a general election now. Ian Murray said Labour had now set its sights “firmly on first place”.

title: 1990s: Are they coming back?

title: Rishi Sunak urges Right to come together after by-election losses
description: And if they are defeated in both Wellingborough and Kingswood, it would be the third time that two by-elections have been lost on the same day during Rishi Sunak’s premiership. The Tory majority in Kingswood is 11,200, while Wellingborough has a majority of 18,540.

title: Trump's Legal Debts Top A Half-Billion Dollars. Will He Have To Pay?
description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump ’s legal debts might now exceed a half-billion dollars. A New York judge ordered Trump and his companies Friday to pay $355 million in fines, plus interest, after ruling that he had manipulated his net worth in financial statements.

title: Wellingborough by-election: Five things we learned
description: The dust has settled, 30,000-odd votes have been counted and Wellingborough has a new MP. The election was called after a recall petition ousted the former member Peter Bone, whose partner was chosen as the Conservative candidate. But what have we learned during the Northamptonshire constituency's by-election?
